question: Which of the following school was founded by Madhvacharya?
explanation: The Dvaita school which stands for dualism (difference between Brahm and Atman) was founded by Madhvacharya influenced Vaishnavism, the Bhakti movement in medieval India. He has been one of the three influential Vedanta philosophies, along with Advaita Vedanta and Vishishtadvaita Vedanta.
